title: 111_hr5333
content: The Act is titled the "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act." It involves the Department of Defense recognizing dependent children of armed forces members. The Act titled "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" amends Chapter 57 of title 10, United States Code, by introducing a new section for a lapel button to recognize eligible children of active duty armed forces members. The Secretary of Defense will approve the design and establish an application process for eligible children to receive the commemorative lapel button. Upon processing of the application and payment of the fee required, the Secretary presents a children of military service members commemorative lapel button to eligible child dependents of a member. The cost of the lapel button covers manufacturing and distribution. Each eligible child dependent can receive only one lapel button, even if they have multiple military member parents. The Secretary may replace a lost, destroyed, or unfit children of military service members commemorative lapel button for eligible child dependents upon application and payment. Eligible child dependents are defined as dependents of certain armed forces members. The Secretary of Defense will issue necessary regulations for implementation. The Secretary will ensure uniform regulations for each armed force. A new item is added to the table of sections. The Secretary of Defense is urged by Congress to expedite the design, manufacture, and issuance of a commemorative lapel button for children of military service members. Additionally, the Secretary is required to make the button retroactively available. Children of military service members can apply for a commemorative lapel button through a process established by the Secretary of Defense. Eligibility is based on being a dependent of a member of the Armed Forces who served on active duty for more than 30 days. The Secretary of Defense will notify eligible members of the Armed Forces about the availability of the children of military service members commemorative lapel button within 60 days of the enactment of the Act. Applications for the lapel button must be submitted within one year of the announcement of its availability. Costs, limitations, and exceptions from section 1126a of title 10, United States Code, apply to the presentation of a children of military service members commemorative lapel button.
